```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

library(knitr)
library(igraphdata)
library(igraph)
library(network)

data(enron)
```

```{r}
##
# preprocess the role for the dataset aka preprocess the nodes
##
enron <- enron - V(enron)[V(enron)$Note == "NA"]

process_position <- function(p){
  if(grepl("CEO", p)){
    return("CEO")
  }
  if(grepl("Director", p)){
    return("Director")
  }
  if(grepl("Vice President", p)){
    return("Vice President")
  }
  if(grepl("President", p)){
    return("President")
  }
  if(grepl("Trader", p)){
    return("Trader")
  }
  if(grepl("Director", p)){
    return("Director")
  }
  if(grepl("Lawyer", p)){
    return("Lawyer")
  }
  if(grepl("Manager", p)){
    return("Manager")
  }
  if(grepl("Employee", p)){
    return("Employee")
  }
  return("Other")
}

V(enron)$role <- sapply(V(enron)$Note, process_position)
```

```{r}
##
# preprocess the edges of the dataset to only keep relevant data about 
# the enron scandel 
##

# 16 indicates the downfall of the company
enron <- enron - E(enron)[E(enron)$LDC_topic > 16 | E(enron)$LDC_topic < 16]

# construct an adjacency matrix
enron.adj = as_adjacency_matrix(enron)
```
